abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would assist
            Government to define a least-cost long-term program of power
            development and to improve the organization and management
            of the power sector.  The project would also help NIGELEC
            improve its internal organization, manpower planning,
            training, financial management, and its distribution system.
            The project would provide for:  (a) a power planning study
            to devise the least-cost program of system development,
            engineering for preparation of bid documents for the next
            power project in the program, and technical assistance in
            the supervision of these studies.  It would also provide
            for:  (b) a study of future sector organization; (c) a study
            of NIGELEC's internal organization, management, and
            manpower requirements; and (d) training of NIGELEC engineers
            and technicians.  Finally, the project would include (e) a
            study of NIGELEC's tariff based on long-run marginal
            cost principles; and (f) equipment to rehabilitate and
            improve the operational efficiency of part of NIGELEC's
            distribution system.
